task_summary: Detect the T-block and the goal outline, approach with a circular pusher, make contact, then push the block toward the goal and perform a corrective nudge if needed before retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A table-top manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block to a marked target outline on the workspace. The contact-sheet shows perception, approach, contact, and pushing phases, with the block ultimately relocated near the right side of the scene. The plan relies on visual detection, alignment of yaw for a straight push, gentle contact, a principal push stroke, and an optional corrective nudge, then retreat. Timing bins reflect a 10 Hz loop by choosing the nearest allowed action timeouts.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except the T-block and target outline
Camera provides view of block and goal
Robot is above table and ready
End-effector is circular and free of obstacles
stepwise_plan: Move above the block and align yaw
Approach until first contact with low force
Execute a primary straight push toward the goal
If not at goal, issue a small corrective push
success_criteria: T-block footprint overlaps the target outline within alignment tolerance
Tool retreats to a safe height after pushing
failure_and_recovery: If contact not detected, repeat approach
If push undershoots, perform corrective nudge
If misalignment occurs, re-align and re-push
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after the block is at the target or after completing the corrective attempt and retreat.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Detect the T-block pose; retried for robustness.
Detect the goal outline pose; retried similarly.
Move to a safe pre-contact height above the block.
Orient the circular tool for a straight lateral push.
Align lateral position relative to the block.
Descend gently until contact is sensed.
Primary push stroke toward the target region.
Check if the block matches the goal pose.
Small corrective nudge if not at goal.
Back off to a safe distance after pushing.
Brief pause to stabilize and allow observation.

failure_modes: Object not detected or partially occluded
Contact not achieved due to misalignment or height error
Insufficient push distance or wrong direction
recovery_strategy: Retry detections up to three times
Re-approach and lower again until contact
Issue corrective push via fallback branch
Retreat and reassess if forces exceed threshold
assumptions: Instruction colors differ from frames; the block appears red in frames though instruction says gray, and target outline appears blue; behavior grounded on frames
Chosen push direction 0° (screen-right) based on apparent final block position in later frames
Timeout bins snapped to nearest allowed values to approximate 10 Hz loop

expected_success_criteria: Block’s centroid and orientation fall within the goal outline tolerance after the push
No collisions with table fixtures and stable retreat posture achieved
